section-block.flip_chart-concept-question: How do we measure how big, how much, or how many?

flip_chart-teacher-facing-paragraph.flip_chart-teacher-direction-text: [Sing to the tune of “The Wheels on the Bus”]

flip_chart-centered-content.flip_chart-teacher-facing-paragraph: A ruler can measure long and short, long and short, long and short. A ruler can measure long and short. That’s how we measure length!
The pencil is long and the crayon is short, the crayon is short, the crayon is short. The pencil is long and the crayon is short. What else is long or short?
A scale can measure heavy and light, heavy and light, heavy and light. A scale can measure heavy and light. That’s how we measure weight!
The rock is heavy and the feather is light, the feather is light, the feather is light. The rock is heavy and the feather is light. What else is heavy or light?
A cup can measure a little and a lot, a little and a lot, a little and a lot. A cup can measure a little and a lot. That’s how we measure amount!
A half cup is a little and a full cup is a lot, a full cup is a lot, a full cup is a lot. A half cup is a little and a full cup is a lot. What else is a little or a lot?
A thermometer can measure cold and hot, cold and hot, cold and hot. A thermometer can measure cold and hot. That’s how we measure temperature!
The snowman is cold and the sun is hot, the sun is hot, the sun is hot. The snowman is cold and the sun is hot. What else is cold or hot?
